thread.title: Fishing: Jim Freda's saltwater report for Oct. 16
thread.title_full: Fishing: Jim Freda's saltwater report for Oct. 16

title: Fishing: Jim Freda's saltwater report for Oct. 16
text:
Fishing: Jim Freda's saltwater report for Oct. 16 October 16, 2015 Last updated: Friday, October 16, 2015, 1:21 AM The Record Print 
JIM FREDA’S SALTWATER REPORT 
BEST BET: False albacore and small bluefish are feeding on small rain baits along the inshore ocean waters. Striped bass are still absent from the mix. Big blues, porgies and blackfish are biting on the inshore wrecks. Offshore in the canyons, yellowfin and longfin tuna are biting well. Many state rivers and streams are now stocked with trout. 
HOT BAITS: Small Ava-17’s are a good slim profile metal lure to cast to false albacore that will imitate the small rain baits that are present in the ocean. 
HOT SPOTS: Inshore ocean waters from Monmouth Beach south to Deal have had a good concentration of rain baits with small blues and false albacore on them in the last week. Look for these pods in about 45 feet of water. 
ANNOUNCEMENTS: Through Wednesday, fall trout stocking, no closed dates. Saturday, Jersey Coast Shark Anglers Striped Bass Tournament, captain’s meeting today, JCSA clubhouse, 385 Herbertsville Rd., Brick, 7 p.m. Oct 20, SWABC monthly meeting, American Legion Post No. 170, 33 West Passaic St., Rochelle Park, 8 p.m. Oct. 23-25, Hi Mar 40-Hour Striped Bass Tournament, check out www.hi-mar.com/tournaments/fall-tournaments for more info. 
TIP OF THE WEEK: The run of king, coho and steelhead salmon is currently on at the Salmon River in Pulaski, N.Y. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
